definition: to surpass/to exceed/to transcend
to exceed/to overtake/to surpass/to transcend/to pass/to cross/ultra-/super-
generic word for peoples or states of south China or south Asia at different historical periods/abbr. for Vietnam 越南
to exceed/to climb over/to surpass/the more... the more
transcendental number (math.)
inner transcendence (perfection through one's own inner moral cultivation, as in Confucianism, for example)
outer transcendence (perfection through the agency of God)

sentences.english: Well, Translucency is one of those phenomenon that goes a bit beyond your everyday Lambertian diffuse.
sentences.chinese: 那么，这些现象是半透明多少超越你天天朗伯漫。

sentences.english: The most insignificant transgression reverberated in the most ethereal worlds.
sentences.chinese: 最微不足道的罪行在最超越尘俗的天地里引起回响。

sentences.english: No organization or individual is privileged to be beyond the Constitution or the law.
sentences.chinese: 任何组织或者个人都不得有超越宪法和法律的特权。

sentences.english: "Crossing" during the struggle for the self-transcendence, "Mori" for a better future.
sentences.chinese: “渡”为自我超越的奋斗过程，“森”为美好前景。

sentences.english: This would be a valid passing opportunity regardless of whether there was pre-existing overlap.
sentences.chinese: 这时后车有权超越，无论有无预先存在“重叠”。

sentences.english: As for the congratulations from De Rossi, our friendship goes beyond football.
sentences.chinese: 至于德罗西的祝贺，我想说我们的友情超越了足球。

sentences.english: The worker's deed was beyond the call of duty.
sentences.chinese: 这位工人的行为超越了职责的要求。

sentences.english: Even those who question faith think twice about crossing the priesthood .
sentences.chinese: 即使是那些问题三番两次超越光明的信仰。

sentences.english: beyond travel, vagabonding is an outlook on life.
sentences.chinese: 流浪超越了旅行的概念，它是一种人生观。

sentences.english: The totality of the purposefulness of that which we are, which transcends consciousness.
sentences.chinese: 那趋向完满的我们的内在本质，它超越了意识。

sentences.english: That is how people should overcome their left side, by putting their attention away from the dead things.
sentences.chinese: 这就是人们应当怎样让注意力脱离死物，以超越左脉。

sentences.english: The past must be kept in its place, outlived and outgrown.
sentences.chinese: 必须把过去保持在属于它的地方，并且超越它。

sentences.english: The protoss' ability to manipulate time and space far surpasses the limited understanding of other races.
sentences.chinese: 神族操纵时间和空间的能力已经远远超越了其他种族。

sentences.english: Chinese medical knowledge surpasses science and includes the science of human body!
sentences.chinese: 中华医道超越科学，并可包容人体科学。

sentences.english: Maybe after the next round of league, there would have been north of Nanjing Institute of beyond.
sentences.chinese: 或许下轮联赛过后，南京有有就将被北理工超越。

definition: to overtake
to create/to bring about/to produce/to set (a record)
to hope to reach/to strive for
to be shoulder to shoulder/to be on an equal level with/Taiwan pr. [bi4 jian1]
accomplishment/success/achievement/CL:個|个[ge4]/to achieve (a result)/to create/to bring about
to reach/to achieve/to attain
milestone
second only to.../(in second place) preceded only by...
to break/to smash
to aspire to the throne/to aim at (the first place etc)
to run neck and neck/to keep pace with/to keep abreast of/on a par with one another
to discuss two disparate things together (idiom); to mention on equal terms/to place on a par with/(often with negatives: impossible to mention X in the same breath as Y)
strategic pass/barrier or mark (i.e. a level considered impressive, usually a round figure such as 10,000)/instrument of torture used to break limbs
summit/apex/pinnacle (of one's career etc)/peak (of a civilization etc)
surpassing by far
to leap to (a higher position etc)/to jump/(of a plane) to ascend
